data.title: LOVE THIS PLACE
data.text: Sushi in the US has become mostly standardized wherever you go, and honestly Sushi X II is no exception. But the difference is that they do a $25 all you can eat option and they don't sacrifice quality to do this. This is rare and this is what makes it my favorite sushi place in the area. The staff is also super nice -- the sushi chefs are always friendly and chat with people. Love this place. Highly recommended for sushi lovers who want to binge.

data.title: Odd punitive business model for all you can eat. Big on rice, small on fish
data.text:
Wanted to like them. $14.95 for all you can eat. BUT if you order more than you can eat, you pay a la carte prices. Interesting business model based on 'don't waste food'. 

The craftsmanship (nori wrapping, slicing) and  portion size are fine. What's missing (sadly) is vinegared rice laced with wasabi. Oh! and the fish (also missing or at least in a very small quantity relative to rice). 

More to the point, our bill came to $31 and change for two. But that's a lot to pay for below supermarket quality sushi rice. You can only eat so much plain rice.

I hate it when I have to give negative reviews. Restaurants are hard business. But, they need to up their game beyond trying to defend against people who try to break their 'all you can eat' model. We were the only ones in the restaurant at lunch today. We should learn from the wisdom of the crowds and stay away.

data.title: All you can eat good sushi, enough said.
data.text: My brother told me about this place recently. I didn't think it would be that good until I went there with him and tried it. The sushi is on par with other sushi places. The price is fair for all you can eat. I recommend white tuna, red scallop, peppered tuna, peppered salmon, and the snapper. The hand rolled tuna and salmon are also good.

data.title: Awasome sushi! You will love it!
data.text: Try it.. Here is one of my favorite places! Big selection, fresh, nice people, good green tè and fried banana as desert... You will love it. It is just for 24 per person, all you can eat!

data.title: I've had better
data.text: Went to this place for the first time the other night. I felt like the sushi rolls were tasteless. I had the butterfly roll and the sweet potato roll. The sweet potato was undercooked. The butterfly rolls was like eating plain rice, no flavor at all. The ribs were good but very salty and I liked the rock shrimp and crab Rangoon. It was not worth the trip. I liked the ginger ice cream and red bean ice cream but the fried bananas were too mushy in the tempura. I've had better. The waiters were ok, they didn't seem like they wanted to be there. A smile would be nice.

data.title: LOVE Sushi X!
data.text: I come here all the time for all you can eat (and all you can drink sake).  The sushi is some of the best around.  The special rolls are awesome.  The items on the kitchen menu are tasty as well.  All you can eat lunch is good but a limited menu compared to dinner.

data.title: Bang for your buck
data.text: If you enjoy sushi and you find yourself in Stamford, this is the perfect place. Their all-you-can eat special is a great value in the Stamford area considering that it is located in busy downtown. I love going there for lunch, but make sure that you check their hours before going. They close in the hours before dinner.

data.title: Good food
data.text: the beautiful wife and I had some shrimp tempura roll and someone told us to try the couple's roll and I most say it was greattttttttttttttttt, my wife had the best time of her life

data.title: Tasty for all you can eat
data.text: If you want to stuff your face with sushi this is the place in stamford.  All you can eat, reasonably-priced.  I think it's called the Philly roll, whatever it is if you love cream cheese then you should try it!  Tempura rolls are just as delicious!

data.title: Hungry? Enjoy sushi? This is your place !
data.text: My "go-to" restaurant when it's my son and I. Fish is fresh and tasty. Service is decent. Could eat there every day of the week.

data.title: Left very full!
data.text: All you can eat!  I love sushi so I was very excited.  This is not a buffet and all food is made to order.  We more than ate our  $22 worth. The place smelled like a fish market and I was concerned at first,  but the sushi tasted fresh.  The servers remove your plate very quickly, almost to quick.  They are also very soft spoken so it is challenging to understand what they are  saying.   Look past those few details because the flavor of the food is worth it.

data.title: Good sushi and all you can eat menu
data.text: They have a great all you can eat menu! Usually in the evening it is around $22, and if you can get there for lunchtime is $12! the selection of the all you can eat is really good and nice fish! they also have a hot menu as well if you dont want sushi, dessert is included in the all you can eat! The staff are friendly, atmosphere is ok, could do with playing some music in the brackground or something!

data.title: Great price for a festival and delicious sushi!!!
data.text:
I've been going to Sushi X for the past 3 year and it is one of my favorite places to go. Even though most of the servers speak poor english, they are all very fast and friendly. 
They have a good variety of sushis, rolls, salads, hot meals and deserts. 
It's either good to go at lunch time or dinner, but always ask for the dinner menu (it have more options).

data.title: Phenomenal !  Great, high quality  quality Sushi and not just " good for a buffet"
data.text:
We used to trek to Manhattan for this kind of amazing AYCE Sushi deal, but now, Stamford has come of age!

The food is fantastic, the servers are friendly and hard working, but their focus is in getting large quantities of food (and sake, if that is your choice)  out to their ever growing posse of loyal customers.....in other words, if you desire a discussion on  the relative merits of Red Snapper versus Yellowtail Sashimi,  you're in the wrong place. 

The fish is fresh, the portions are generous, and if you buy into their all you can drink deal, they are generous with the refills of hot or cold Sake. 

My only complaint, and it is a tiny one, is that we now eat here so often that I'd love to see a weekly or even a monthly "special Roll" added,   so that we may  continue to widen our Sushi World while remaining loyal customers!

FYI-  Parking can be tough downtown , but Sushi X validates if you park at the landmark Square Garage directly across Atlantic Street from their front door.

**Note** you must enter and exit with your car from that garage entrance!

data.title: Love all you can eat...
data.text: A bunch of friends and I came here for dinner. Combined for all you can eat sushi, all you can drink sake, and one Sapporo, it came out to around $35, a great deal in my mind. We had a large group but still got served in a reasonable amount of time.

data.title: Decent All You Cam Eat Lunch
data.text: Tried Sushi X for lunch this week. Wasn't overly impressed. Very limited menu of all you can eat sushi compared to competition on East Main St not too far away, Kumo. Salmon was not wild caught, def farm raised. Tuna had food processor consistency. Shumai on the other hand was quite nice. Delicately fried and an appealing presentation. Poor quality of chicken in the chicken teriyaki, rubbery. Food kind of lost its appeal half way through...For the $13 you can certainly find enough to fill you up. Personally I like Kumo better.

data.title: A shard of hard plastic in a roll...not even an apology!
data.text: Yesterday I found a shard of hard plastic with very sharp edges in a roll. I did not swallow it by a mere luck.....When we showed it to the waitress and quietly asked her to bring the manager, she talked to another guy in a uniform but he did not even come up. Nobody apologized. Everyone at our table was shocked. This is a pity -  it used to be a very nice place but think twice before going....

data.title: Great Sushi and ALL YOU CAN EAT
data.text:
The selection is excellent the price is great and the food is very very tasty and fresh !!  The only negative was 2 families with 7 folks and we all had to write our orders together

Made it challenge when it came out .. BUT IT WAS SO GOOD

data.title: You will not be disappointed
data.text:
The sushi is great. This place never disappoints. It's a VERY casual spot that you go to to EAT, not for the atmosphere or any bells and whistles. Great for groups of friends, large families or solo dining.

Select the "all you can eat option" and sample their sushi, sashimi, soups, salads and sides.

data.title: Great Lunch
data.text: My favorite lunch special in Stamford! 2 rolls, soup and salad for $8! The quality and price are great! THey also have a $20 (or $25?) all-you-can-eat option for lunch too. Dinner is $35 and includes sashimi
